data.why:
Module for implementing encrypted CGI sessions. It will add
    functionality to CGI::Session and support the existing CGI::Session
    drivers, ids and serializers. From the user's point of view, it will
    be used exactly like CGI::Session; with the different that the
    session id contains two parts: the id used for persisting the
    session and a key used for encrypting the persisted data. The key is
    not persisted on the server.

    The main module will be CGI::Session::Encrypted and there will be
    additional modules handling encryption (i.e.
    CGI::Session::Encrypted::Crypt::CBC) and key generation (i.e.
    CGI::Session::Encrypted::Key::MD5).
